name: ChangeNotifier
comment:
Mixin and base class for implementing an observe/observe-html.Observable object that performs its own change notifications, and does not need to be considered by observe/observe-html.Observable.dirtyCheck.

When a field, property, or indexable item is changed, a derived class should call observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange. See that method for an example.

changes.name: changes
changes.comment:
The stream of change records to this object. Records will be delivered asynchronously.

observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.deliverChanges can be called to force synchronous delivery.

hasObservers.name: hasObservers
hasObservers.comment: True if this object has any observers, and should call observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange for changes.

deliverChanges.name: deliverChanges
deliverChanges.comment: Synchronously deliver pending observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.changes. Returns true if any records were delivered, otherwise false.

notifyChange.name: notifyChange
notifyChange.comment:
Notify observers of a change.

For most objects observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange is more convenient, but collections sometimes deliver other types of changes such as a observe/observe-src-list_diff.ListChangeRecord.

Notes: - This is not required for fields if you mixin or extend observe/observe-html.Observable, but you can use it for computed properties. - Unlike observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier this will not schedule observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.deliverChanges; use observe/observe-src-observable.Observable.dirtyCheck instead.

notifyPropertyChange.name: notifyPropertyChange
notifyPropertyChange.comment:
Notify that the field name of this object has been changed.

The observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.oldValue and observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.newValue are also recorded. If the two values are equal, no change will be recorded.

For convenience this returns observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.newValue. This makes it easy to use in a setter:

var _myField;
@reflectable get myField => _myField;
@reflectable set myField(value) {
  _myField = notifyPropertyChange(#myField, _myField, value);
}

observed.name: observed
observed.comment: Override this method to be called when the observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.changes are first observed.

unobserved.name: unobserved
unobserved.comment: Override this method to be called when the observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.changes are no longer being observed.

changes.name: changes
changes.comment:
The stream of change records to this object. Records will be delivered asynchronously.

observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.deliverChanges can be called to force synchronous delivery.

hasObservers.name: hasObservers
hasObservers.comment: True if this object has any observers, and should call observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyChange for changes.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

deliverChanges.name: deliverChanges
deliverChanges.comment: Synchronously deliver pending observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.changes. Returns true if any records were delivered, otherwise false.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

notifyChange.name: notifyChange
notifyChange.comment:
Notify observers of a change.

For most objects observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange is more convenient, but collections sometimes deliver other types of changes such as a observe/observe-src-list_diff.ListChangeRecord.

Notes: - This is not required for fields if you mixin or extend observe/observe-html.Observable, but you can use it for computed properties. - Unlike observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier this will not schedule observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.deliverChanges; use observe/observe-src-observable.Observable.dirtyCheck instead.

notifyPropertyChange.name: notifyPropertyChange
notifyPropertyChange.comment:
Notify that the field name of this object has been changed.

The observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.oldValue and observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.newValue are also recorded. If the two values are equal, no change will be recorded.

For convenience this returns observe/observe-html.ChangeNotifier.notifyPropertyChange.newValue.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
